title: 111_hr3282
content: The program provides readjustment and mental health care services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a program to provide peer outreach, support, counseling, and mental health services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, as well as education and support to their immediate family members. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will establish a program to provide education, support, counseling, and mental health services to assist veterans in readjusting to civilian life, recovering from injuries or illnesses incurred during deployment, and helping their families. Community mental health centers and qualified entities will be contracted to provide these services in underserved areas. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will contract community health centers or entities to provide services in underserved areas, requiring them to employ veterans, use telehealth services, participate in training programs, comply with VA protocols, and submit annual reports. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs contracts community health centers to provide services in underserved areas. They must employ veterans, use telehealth services, participate in training programs, comply with VA protocols, submit annual reports, and provide clinical summary information for each veteran receiving mental health services. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs contracts community health centers to provide mental health services, including training programs for veterans and clinicians to ensure quality care. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs contracts community health centers to provide mental health services for veterans, including training programs for clinicians to ensure quality care. The Secretary is required to submit a report outlining plans for implementing the program within 45 days of the enactment of the Act. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs must submit a report to Congress on the implementation of the mental health services program for veterans, including the number of veterans served and types of services provided. The report to Congress must include an evaluation of services provided to veterans, recommendations on extending service periods, a list of national mental health organizations offering services, and an assessment of training programs.
